intro: Lasiodiscus gillardinii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters and thrives in bright, indirect light. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white, and it is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Lasiodiscus gillardinii requires well-draining soil and moderate watering to prevent root rot.
